block.l: try { if ((eb != undefined ? eb.connected : false) || (world.USB != '' && world.USB != undefined)){ return true; } else { return false; } } catch(e) { return false; }

try { if ((eb != undefined ? eb.connected : false) || (world.USB != '' && world.USB != undefined)){ //it thinks its connected over websock, let's test the connection if (eb != undefined ? eb.connected : false) { eb.connected = false; eb.version(function(status,msg){eb.connected = true;}); } else { //it thinks we are connected over USB world.USB = ''; writeToStream(' {cmd: "version", id: "k1q6if75si"} '); } } } catch(e) { console.log(e); }

alert("Connection Failure!

In this mode you may connect via USB or over WebSocket

Please type the IP address to use WebSockets or type USB to use the USB port")

try { world.id = Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 10); writeToStream('{cmd: "forward", arg: '+mm+', id: "'+world.id+'"}'); } catch(e) { }
try { var msg = 0; msg.id = 0; msg = JSON.parse(world.USB); return (msg.id == world.id); }catch(e){ return 0; }
try { world.id = Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 10); writeToStream('{cmd: "back", arg: '+mm+', id: "'+world.id+'"}'); } catch(e) { }
try { var msg = 0; msg.id = 0; msg = JSON.parse(world.USB); return (msg.id == world.id); }catch(e){ return 0; }
try { world.id = Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 10); writeToStream('{cmd: "left", arg: '+mm+', id: "'+world.id+'"}'); } catch(e) { }
try { var msg = 0; msg.id = 0; msg = JSON.parse(world.USB); return (msg.id == world.id); }catch(e){ return 0; }
try { world.id = Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 10); writeToStream('{cmd: "right", arg: '+mm+', id: "'+world.id+'"}'); } catch(e) { }
try { var msg = 0; msg.id = 0; msg = JSON.parse(world.USB); return (msg.id == world.id); }catch(e){ return 0; }
if (eb == null) { eb = new EveBrain('ws://192.168.4.1:8899/websocket'); console.log(eb.connected); } else { if (eb.connected == false) { eb.url = "ws://192.168.4.1:8899/websocket"; eb.connect(); } }
try { if(eb != undefined ? eb.connected : false){ return 'WEB'; } else if(world.USB != '' && world.USB != undefined){ return 'USB'; } else { return 'NONE'; } } catch(e) { return "NONE"; }
try { world.id = Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 10); writeToStream('{cmd: "digitalInput", arg: '+Pin+', id: "'+world.id+'"}'); } catch(e) { }
try { var msg = 0; msg.id = 0; msg = JSON.parse(world.USB); world.digitalSensor[Pin] = msg.msg; return (msg.id == world.id); }catch(e){ return 0; }
function next(e) {; return eb.analogSensor; } eb.analogInput(0,next); return eb.analogSensor.level;
try{ writeToStream('{cmd: "analogInput", arg: "A0", id: "k1q6if75si"}'); var J = JSON.parse(world.USB); if (Number.isInteger(J.msg)) { return J.msg; } return 0; } catch(e){ return 0; }
try { world.id = Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 10); writeToStream('{cmd: "distanceSensor", id: "'+world.id+'"}'); } catch(e) { }
try { var msg = 0; msg.id = 0; msg = JSON.parse(world.USB); world.distanceSensor = msg.msg; return (msg.id == world.id && msg.status == "complete"); }catch(e){ return 0; }
try { world.id = Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 10); writeToStream('{cmd: "temperature", id: "'+world.id+'"}'); } catch(e) { }
try { var msg = 0; msg.id = 0; msg = JSON.parse(world.USB); world.temperature = msg.msg; return (msg.id == world.id && msg.status == "complete"); } catch(e) { return 0; }
try { world.id = Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 10); writeToStream('{cmd: "humidity", id: "'+world.id+'"}'); } catch(e) { }
try { var msg = 0; msg.id = 0; msg = JSON.parse(world.USB); world.humidity = msg.msg; return (msg.id == world.id && msg.status == "complete"); } catch(e) { return 0; }
try{ writeToStream('{cmd: "gpio_pwm_5", arg: '+pin_value+', id: "k1q6if75si"}'); var J = JSON.parse(world.USB); return J.msg; } catch(e){ return 0; }
try{ writeToStream('{cmd: "gpio_pwm_10", arg: '+pin_value+', id: "k1q6if75si"}'); var J = JSON.parse(world.USB); return J.msg; } catch(e){ return 0; }
try{ writeToStream('{cmd: "gpio_pwm_16", arg: '+pin_value+', id: "k1q6if75si"}'); var J = JSON.parse(world.USB); return J.msg; } catch(e){ return 0; }
try{ writeToStream('{cmd: "beep", arg: "'+note+','+(duration*1000)+'", id: "k1q6if75si"}'); var J = JSON.parse(world.USB); return J.msg; } catch(e){ return 0; }
var msg = {cmd:"setConfig", arg:{"sta_ssid":SSID,"sta_pass":PASS}, "id":Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 10)}; msg = filterUnicode(msg); eb.send_msg(msg);

eb.send({cmd: 'startWifiScan'}, function(state, msg){ if(state === 'notify' && undefined != msg){ cb(msg.msg); } }); var networks = eb.sensorState["wifiScan"]; let txt = ""; for (let i = 0; i < networks.length; i++){ txt = txt.concat(networks[i][0]); if(i != networks.length){ txt = txt.concat(",");} } return(networks);
try{ writeToStream('{cmd: "startWifiScan", id: "k1q6if75si"}'); var J = JSON.parse(world.USB); return J.msg; } catch(e){ return 0; }
try{ writeToStream('{cmd: "servo", arg:"'+angle+'", id: "3d8d9d4f6k"}'); } catch(e){ console.log(e); }
try{ writeToStream('{cmd: "servoII", arg:"'+angle+'", id: "3d8d9d4f6k"}'); } catch(e){ console.log(e); }

try { var msg = 0; msg.id = 0; msg = JSON.parse(world.USB); world.ip = msg.msg; return (msg.id == world.id); }catch(e){ return 0; }
try { world.id = Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 10); writeToStream('{cmd: "getConfig", id: "'+world.id+'"}'); } catch(e) { }

function isOn(){if(onOff=="On"){return 1;}return 0;} var msg = {cmd:"postToServer", arg:{"onOff":isOn(),"server":server_host,"time":sec}, "id":Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 10)}; msg = filterUnicode(msg); eb.send_msg(msg);

try{ function isOn(){if(onOff=="On"){return 1;}return 0;} writeToStream('{cmd: "postToServer", arg: {\'onOff\':'+isOn()+', \'server\':\''+server_host+'\', \'time\':\''+sec+'\'}, id:"3d8d9d4f6k"}'); } catch(e){ console.log(e); }

block.comment: If paused between points, wait to unpause

custom-block.s: Move plotter to position X %n Y %n Unit: %s
Move plotter to position X %n Y %n Unit: %s

block.comment: If paused in the middle of the point, wait until it's unpaused, then move the millimeters that were remaining. The outer loop exists because someone might pause and unpause many times.

custom-block.comment: These exist to make it easier to export plotter blocks.

custom-block.s: Move plotter relative X %n Y %n Unit: %s
Move plotter to position X %n Y %n Unit: %s
Initialize plotter position to X=0 Y=0

block-definition.s: Initialize plotter position to X=0 Y=0

block.l: function gcodeToPoints(gcode, wheelDiameter, stepsPerTurn) { function badParsed(val) { if (isNaN(val)) { return !(val === undefined || val === null); } else { return false; } } var units = "mm"; // Implemented commands: // g1 and g0: move to the specified X and Y coordinates. // g20: inches g21: millimeters // M2: program end // Unimplemented, but might implement: // g90: absolute positioning // g91: relative positioning var points = []; var lines = gcode.split(/\r?\n/); for (l of lines) { // cut comment if it exists if (l.includes(";")) { l = l.split(";")[0]; } if (l.startsWith("G20")) { units = "inches"; } else if (l.startsWith("G21")) { units = "mm"; } else if (l.startsWith("G1") || l.startsWith("G0")) { var line = l.split(" "); var point = {}; for (const c of line) { if (c.startsWith("X")) { point.X = parseFloat(c.substring(1)); if (units === "inches") { point.X *= 25.4; } } else if (c.startsWith("Y")) { point.Y = parseFloat(c.substring(1)); if (units === "inches") { point.Y *= 25.4; } } } // if saw an X or Y but could not parse the number, stop parsing. if (badParsed(point.X) || badParsed(point.Y)) { morphicAlert("Error!", "Invalid point " + l + " for command G1"); return new List([]); } else { // if the G1 is missing an X or Y, silently ignore it if (typeof point.X === 'number' && typeof point.Y === 'number') { points.push(point); } } } else if (l.startsWith("M2")) { break; // stop job when we see M2 } } if (points.length === 0) { morphicAlert("Error!", "No points were found in the Gcode"); return new List([]); } var Xcoords = []; var Ycoords = []; for (const point of points) { Xcoords.push(Math.round(convertMMToSteps(point.X, wheelDiameter, stepsPerTurn))); Ycoords.push(Math.round(convertMMToSteps(point.Y, wheelDiameter, stepsPerTurn))); } return new List([new List(Xcoords), new List(Ycoords)]); } PlotterState = function() { this.paused = false; this.position = new PlotterCoordinate(); // both of these are only used by the gcode code, // so they are in STEPS only. this.goalPoint = new GoalPoint(new PlotterCoordinate(), 0, 0); this.pausedPosition = {X:0, Y:0}; this.inJob = false; this.savePausedPosition = function(eb) { // Save the plotter's current position into its tracked position. // Note that the plotter is allowed to move between paused and unpaused. this.position.X.setSteps(this.goalPoint.X - (this.goalPoint.Xdir * eb.lastPausedState.leftMotorRemaining)); this.position.Y.setSteps(this.goalPoint.Y - (this.goalPoint.Ydir * eb.lastPausedState.rightMotorRemaining)); // Save the current, paused position. This is where the plotter will return to when unpaused. this.pausedPosition = {}; this.pausedPosition.X = this.position.X.getSteps(); this.pausedPosition.Y = this.position.Y.getSteps(); } this.setGoalPoint = function(X, Y) { this.goalPoint = new GoalPoint(this.position, X, Y); } } PlotterCoordinate = function() { this.X = new PlotterValue(); this.Y = new PlotterValue(); } function GoalPoint(position, X, Y) { this.Xdir = X - position.X.getSteps() > 0 ? 1 : -1; this.Ydir = Y - position.Y.getSteps() > 0 ? 1 : -1; this.X = X; this.Y = Y; } const PlotterValueProto = { setSteps: function(value) { this.value = value; }, getSteps: function() { return this.value; }, incrementSteps: function(value) { this.value += value; }, setMM: function(value, wheelDiameter, stepsPerTurn) { this.value = convertMMToSteps(value, wheelDiameter, stepsPerTurn); }, getMM: function(wheelDiameter, stepsPerTurn) { return convertStepsToMM(this.value, wheelDiameter, stepsPerTurn); }, incrementMM: function(value, wheelDiameter, stepsPerTurn) { this.value += convertMMToSteps(value, wheelDiameter, stepsPerTurn); } } function PlotterValue() { this.value = 0; } PlotterValue.prototype = PlotterValueProto; PlotterValue.prototype.constructor = PlotterValue; function convertMMToSteps(value, wheelDiameter, stepsPerTurn) { return value * (stepsPerTurn / (Math.PI * wheelDiameter)); } function convertStepsToMM(value, wheelDiameter, stepsPerTurn) { return value / (stepsPerTurn / (Math.PI * wheelDiameter)); } // Create the plotter state object world.plotterState = new PlotterState(); world.modifiedPlotter = true;

block-definition.s: Move plotter to position X %'X' Y %'Y' Unit: %'unit'

custom-block.s: Move plotter relative X %n Y %n Unit: %s

block-definition.s: Move plotter relative X %'deltax' Y %'deltay' Unit: %'unit'

block.l: var position = world.plotterState.position; position.X.incrementMM(deltax, wheelDiameter, stepsPerTurn); position.Y.incrementMM(deltay, wheelDiameter, stepsPerTurn);
delete world.plotterState.pausedPosition; delete world.plotterState.goalPoint; world.plotterState.paused = false;

block.comment: Add the ebrain JS if needed, so that morphic alert will be available.

custom-block.comment: pause to get the mm remaining in the current move, then stop and resume to allow the user to move the plotter manually.

block.comment: Check if the motors were actually moving

block.l: morphicAlert("ERROR!", "Plotter is not in a job, so cannot pause or stop it. Use the regular stop or pause blocks");

custom-block.s: Move plotter to position X %n Y %n Unit: %s

block-definition.translations: fr:Exécuter modèle de son Teachable Machine _

block.l: morphicDialog(new Color(115,180,240), "Loading", "Adding Teachable Sound Machine Model to SNAP", "Wait. When you see the request for your microphone, accept. Then, the model has loaded successfully.");

custom-block.l: let soundModel, soundClassLabels; const soundPredictionList=[]; async function soundInit() { // stop old model if it's running. if (typeof soundModel === 'object') { try { await soundModel.stopListening(); } catch(e){} } const a=teachableSoundURL+"model.json",t=teachableSoundURL+"metadata.json"; soundModel = speechCommands.create("BROWSER_FFT", null, a, t); await soundModel.ensureModelLoaded(); soundClassLabels = soundModel.wordLabels(); await soundModel.listen(function(result) { for (let i = 0;i < soundClassLabels.length; i++) { soundPredictionList[i] = result.scores[i].toFixed(2); } }, { includeSpectrogram: false, // in case listen should return result.spectrogram probabilityThreshold: 0.75, invokeCallbackOnNoiseAndUnknown: true, overlapFactor: 0.50 // probably want between 0.5 and 0.75. More info in README }); }

block.l: world.moveon = 0; soundInit().catch(function(e) { if (e.toString().includes("Permission")) { morphicAlert("Error!", "An error has occurred, you may have forgotten to allow your microphone access."); } else { morphicAlert("Error!", "Some error has occurred: " + e); } console.log(e); soundPredictionList.length = 1; // make this block exit. }).then(function(){world.moveon = 1;});
var po = document.createElement('script'); po.type = 'text/javascript'; po.async = true; po.innerHTML = JS_FILE; var s = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0]; s.parentNode.insertBefore(po, s)

world.moveon = 0; var po = document.createElement('script'); po.type = 'text/javascript'; po.async = true; po.src = url; po.addEventListener('load', function (e) { world.moveon = 1;}, false); var s = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0]; s.parentNode.insertBefore(po, s)

morphicDialog(new Color(115,180,240), "Loading","Please Wait -- Adding Teachable Machine Model to SNAP -- When you see the request for your webcam or microphone, then the model has loaded successfully.");

custom-block.l: let model,webcam,labelContainer,maxPredictions; const predictionList=[]; async function init(){ stopImageModel(); const a=teachableURL+"model.json",t=teachableURL+"metadata.json"; model=await tmImage.load(a,t),maxPredictions=model.getTotalClasses(); webcam=new tmImage.Webcam(200,200,!0),await webcam.setup(),await webcam.play(),window.requestAnimationFrame(loop) } async function loop(){ if (model) { webcam.update(),await predict(),window.requestAnimationFrame(loop) } } async function predict(){ const a=await model.predict(webcam.canvas); for(let t=0;t<maxPredictions;t++){ const e=a[t].probability.toFixed(2); predictionList[t]=e } } function stopImageModel() { try { predictionList.length = 0; webcam.stop(); model = undefined; } catch (e) { console.error(e); } }

block.l: world.moveon = 0; init().catch(function(e) { if (typeof e === 'string' && (e.includes("camera"))) { morphicAlert("Error!", "An error has occurred, you may have forgotten to allow your camera access."); } else { morphicAlert("Error!", "Some other error has occurred: " + e); } console.log(e); predictionList.length = 1; // make this block exit. }).then(function(){world.moveon = 1;});

block-definition.translations: fr:Niveau de confiance en classe _ d'image

block.l: try { var prediction = predictionList[i - 1]; if (!prediction) { if (typeof model !== object) { morphicAlert("Error!", "The image model is stopped. Start it before continuing."); } else if (!i) { morphicAlert("Error!", "Specify a class index before using this block."); } else { morphicAlert("Error!", "The class index appears to be wrong. Correct it before continuing"); } } return prediction; } catch (e) { morphicAlert("Error!", "You must load an image model before using the confidence level"); }

block-definition.translations: fr:Niveau de confiance en classe _ de son

input.options: function() { try { out = {}; for (const label of soundClassLabels) { out[label] = label; } return out; } catch (e) { return {}; } }

block.l: try { var prediction = soundPredictionList[soundClassLabels.indexOf(soundClass)]; if (!prediction) { if (soundPredictionList.length === 0) { morphicAlert("Error!", "The sound model is stopped. Start it before continuing."); } else if (!soundClass) { morphicAlert("Error!", "Select a class before using this block."); } else { morphicAlert("Error!", "The class name appears to be wrong. Correct it before continuing"); } } return prediction; } catch (e) { morphicAlert("Error!", "You must load a sound model before using the confidence level"); }

block-definition.translations: fr:Arrêter modèle de son Teachable Machine

block.l: return typeof morphicAlert === 'function' && typeof morphicAlertString === 'function' && typeof activeAlerts === 'object';

custom-block.l: function morphicAlert(title, ...messages) { morphicDialog(new Color(255, 0, 0, 1), title, messages); } function morphicDialog(color, title, ...messages) { if (Array.isArray(messages) && messages.length > 0) { var message = ""; for (var i = 0; i < messages.length - 1; i++) { message += messages[i] + "\n"; } message += messages[messages.length - 1]; morphicAlertString(title, message, color); } else if (typeof messages === "string") { morphicAlertString(title, messages, color); } else if (messages === null || messages === undefined) { morphicAlertString(title, "[Error message is missing. Please report that this happened to the developers.]", color); } else { morphicAlertString(title, messages.toString(), color); } } var activeAlerts = new Map(); function morphicAlertString(title, message, color) { var alertContents = title + message; if (activeAlerts.get(alertContents) !== undefined) { // don't create a dialog if an identical one exists. return; } let box = new DialogBoxMorph(); // make dialog // add label (in the weirdest way imaginable) box.labelString = title; box.createLabel(); const addLabel = function (text, type) { let txt = new TextMorph(text); // Text should be bold to match the snap style but has to be // false here, otherwise the text overflows. txt.isBold = false; box['add' + type](txt); } addLabel(message, 'Body') // do not change the second input of these box.titleBarColor = color || new Color(255, 0, 0, 1); // Make titlebar red if not specified. box.titlePadding = 12; // make titlebar taller // Add this box to the activeAlerts map, and make the close button work. activeAlerts.set(alertContents, box); box.cancelAndProcess = function() { box.ok(); activeAlerts.delete(alertContents); } // This button will close the dialog and remove it from the list of active alerts box.addButton('cancelAndProcess', 'Close'); box.fixLayout(); // required, otherwise box looks weird box.popUp(world); // popup box }

block-definition.s: speak %'text' with %'lang' accent $nl and pitch %'pitch' rate %'rate'
block-definition.translations: de:sprich _ mit _ Aussprache _ und Höhe _ Geschwindigkeit _ pt:fala _ na língua _ _ com tom _ e velocidade _ ca:digues _ amb accent _ _ to _ i velocitat _

block-definition.s: speak %'text' with %'lang' accent $nl and pitch %'pitch' rate %'rate' and wait

custom-block.s: speak %s with %txt accent %br and pitch %n rate %n and wait
